author: Lee Tolliver
title: All-Tidewater 2014 | Boys soccer
text:
ALL-TIDEWATER FIRST TEAM PLAYER OF THE YEAR
PETER PEARSON , Cape Henry, Senior midfielder/forward
Scored 29 goals and had 15 assists. Finished his five-year varsity career with 136 goals and 51 assists. Four-time Tidewater Conference Player of the Year. Four-time first-team All-VISAA. Four-time All-Tidewater first-team selection. Two-time All-Tidewater Player of the Year. Signed with Virginia. Read more about Pearson
____
MICHAEL ABRAHAM , Grassfield, Senior midfielder
Scored 10 goals and had 11 assists. First-team All-Monitor-Merrimac Conference. First-team All-South Region (6A). Signed with Marshall. Helped the Grizzlies advance to their first state semifinal. ____
NATHAN BERNING , Grassfield, Senior defender
Monitor-Merrimac Conference Player of the Year. First-team All-South Region (6A). Had two assists. Signed with Lynchburg College. Key to a Grizzlies team that allowed only six goals in advancing to its first state semifinal. ____
MATT BURTNER , Ocean Lakes, Senior defender
Scored three goals and had two assists. First-team All-Coastal Conference. First-team All-South Region (6A). Key to a Dolphins defense that allowed only 13 goals in advancing to Ocean Lakes’ first region semifinal. ____
JOHAN DE PICKER , Ocean Lakes, Junior midfielder
Scored 14 goals and had eight assists. First-team All-Coastal Conference. First-team All-South Region (6A). The football team’s placekicker had a dangerous foot and scored eight of the team’s final 11 goals. ____
GABE EVERETTE , Nansemond River, Senior forward
Scored 14 goals and had 16 assists. Ironclad Conference Player of the Year. First-team All-South Region (4A). Led the Warriors to their first-ever playoff run, advancing to the region semifinals. ____
MARSHAL MACCARTNEY , Hickory, Senior midfielder
Scored nine goals and had four assists. PenSouth Conference Player of the Year. First-team All-South Region (5A). Instrumental in the Hawks’ first state playoff run, advancing to the semifinals. ____
KENDALL MCINTOSH , Bayside, Senior midfielder/forward
Scored 12 goals and had 10 assists. First-team All-Coastal Conference. First-team All-South Region (6A). Signed with Radford. Led a trio of seniors that guided the Marlins to their best season. ____
DREW OTT , Norfolk Academy, Senior midfielder
Scored 22 goals and had 11 assists. Three-time All-Tidewater Conference first-team pick. Two-time All-VISAA first-team selection. Two-time All-Tidewater first-teamer. Signed with Virginia Tech. Another in a long line of talented Bulldogs midfielders. ____
LOGAN RATNER , Landstown, Senior goalkeeper
Allowed five goals and had 83 saves. All-Coastal Conference Goalie of the Year. Signed with Methodist University. Recorded 11 shutouts as the Eagles advanced to the South Region (6A) quarterfinals. ____
TREVOR SINCLAIR , Hickory, Senior forward
Scored 10 goals and had five assists. First-team All-PenSouth Conference. First-team All-South Region (5A). Key offensive player in a Hawks attack the advanced to the team’s first state semifinal. ____
GARRETT WALKE , Landstown, Senior midfielder
Scored 10 goals and had 14 assists. Coastal Conference Player of the Year. First-team All-South Region (6A). Two-time All-Tidewater first-teamer. Signed with ODU. Four-year starter with outstanding footwork. ____
SECOND TEAM
Nick Evans , Grassfield, junior goalkeeper
Lee Hogge , Maury, junior midfielder
Wes Horbal , Cox, senior forward
Tanner Kling , Hickory, senior midfielder
David Kotarides , Norfolk Academy, senior defender
Frank Luster , Grassfield, senior forward
Justin McFarland , First Colonial, senior midfielder
Travis McHarttie , Bayside, senior forward
Austin McKenzie , Landstown, senior midfielder
Bryce Reed , Kellam, senior defender
Mickias Tesfamariam , Bayside, senior forward
